message.content:
cs.PF, cs.AI, cs.DC, cs.AR, cs.PL

The paper presents a new adaptive framework for data-driven applications that uses a predictive model to select optimal algorithmic parameters. This involves machine learning techniques and optimization of performance, which suggests that the paper could belong to the following sub-categories:

- cs.PF (Performance): This sub-category deals with performance optimization of computer systems, which is the main focus of the paper.
- cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence): The paper uses machine learning techniques to select optimal algorithmic parameters, which falls under the scope of this sub-category.
- cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing): The paper presents experimental results for two GPU architectures, which suggests that it could belong to this sub-category.
- cs.AR (Hardware Architecture): The paper discusses exploiting hardware characteristics such as local memories and vector units, which falls under the scope of this sub-category.
- cs.PL (Programming Languages): The paper deals with optimizing routines in a library, which could fall under the scope of this sub-category.
